top_anomalies.title: Vanity Stocks: Apparel Adapting to Shifting Body Sizes
top_anomalies.snippet: As GLP‑1 weight-loss drug adoption grows 12–15% of U.S. adults are currently or planning to use them—food, wellness and fashion brands are pivoting to address new consumer priorities. Today, we are going to focus on fashion brands.

top_anomalies.title: Figma Stock Price Jumps 250% Thursday After IPO
top_anomalies.snippet: Figma was founded by Field, a former Thiel Fellow, began working on Figma alongside his Brown University classmate Evan Wallace in 2012, and first launched a closed beta in 2015. Figma offers a suite of design products accessible in web browsers.

top_anomalies.title: Jaguar stock price fell 17% from ‘woke' ad to CEO's exit
top_anomalies.snippet: Jaguar, the iconic British luxury automaker now owned by India's Tata Motors (NSE: TATAMOTORS), has once again found itself at the center of controversy,  and this time, investors are reacting.

top_anomalies.title: Gerdau's adjusted profit falls near 9% in Q2, tariffs boost US operations
top_anomalies.snippet: Brazilian steelmaker Gerdau on Thursday reported an 8.6% decline in its second-quarter adjusted net profit year-on-year, slightly below analysts' expectations despite stronger performance of North American operations due to U.S. tariffs.

top_anomalies.title: Want To Hedge Against Inflation? Buy A Forest
top_anomalies.snippet: Invest capital and save the planet at the same time. Own a forest.

top_anomalies.title: SEC's Atkins launches ‘Project Crypto' to bring U.S. markets on-chain. Here's what you should know.
top_anomalies.snippet: Paul Atkins, chairman of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, on Thursday announced the launch of “Project Crypto,” a bold and sweeping policy initiative aimed at bringing U.S. financial markets onto the blockchain.

top_anomalies.title: How Tariffs Raise Costs for Farmers, Making Food More Expensive
top_anomalies.snippet: The latest round of tariffs is likely to make agricultural production even more expensive and, potentially, limit access to goods not produced in the United States.

top_anomalies.title: The effort to ban congressional stock trading has a Trump problem
top_anomalies.snippet: The movement to ban lawmakers from trading stocks just got more complicated. Democrats and Republicans are at odds over whether the bill should include Trump too.

top_anomalies.title: The build-out of AI infrastructure is costing a fortune, straining companies and capital markets, writes the WSJ's Greg Ip
top_anomalies.snippet: The build-out of artificial-intelligence infrastructure is costing a fortune, straining companies and capital markets.
